title: Build failing on python 3.8? Numpy

labels.name: Another package code issue
labels.description: Bug/issue that relates to a dlc dependency

body:
**Describe the bug** Please forgive me if this is too simple a problem, or if it should instead be posted on numpy - I am completely new to Python. Anyway, when I run the command `pip install deeplabcut ` I get an error. The error seems to be related the installment of the numpy package, although the numpy package is installed already. I am running python version 3.8.5, and I have the packages installed that comes with the default Anaconda bundle. I am using a Windows machine. **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: Windows10 **To Reproduce** 1. `pip install deeplabcut` 2. See error:
TRACEBACK

**Expected behavior** That deeplabcut is installed **Screenshots** Not applicable **Additional context** Other users have posted about a similar error message on numpy/numpy [(link)](https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/13573). That issue was closed because the error was related to Python version 3.8 which at that time was unstable. I am running Python 3.8.5 (the default that comes with Anaconda), and this version should now be stable. Also, numpy is already installed.
